intro: Pavetta buzica, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Pavetta buzica is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
